result.execSummary:
The defendant Darieon Marquis Lampkin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Attend school as required by law.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Nielsen, re: restitution agreement.

Defendant Darieon Marquis Lampkin in court with attorney Mark Francis Nielsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Leslie Johnson.
Plea:  Cts. 2,4,6 - NC.
BTC:  Cts. 2,4,6 - GUILTY.  Cts. 1,3,5 and 7-42 are DRI.
Withheld sentence, 1 year probation.
Conditions:
Attend school as required by law;
CC+DNA surcharge - provide sample;
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.
To allow defendant to go to job interview
ATTY Nielsen files motion and bond motion.

Defendant Darieon Marquis Lampkin in court with attorney Mark Francis Nielsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Matter was set for PLEAS, but the offer contemplates restitution.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Darieon Marquis Lampkin in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger on behalf of Mark Nielsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Def req bond mod.
State does not object.
BTC:  Bond mod granted.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    No contact with victim store, McDonalds on Douglas Ave,  except for restitution purposes.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, school and meeting w/his Atty.    Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 12-21-2015:  Defendant is allowed to attend funeral of great-grandmother 12-25-2015 through 12-27-2015.**

Defendant Darieon Marquis Lampkin in court with attorney Mark Francis Nielsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
